Uses of Class
DLV.Predicate.Fact

Uses of Predicate.Fact in DLV
 

Methods in DLV that return Predicate.Fact
 Predicate.Fact Predicate.getFact()
          Returns the fact currently pointed by the cursor.
 Predicate.Fact Predicate.getFact(int i)
          Returns the i-th fact.
 Predicate.Fact Predicate.nextFact()
          This method returns the next fact.
 Predicate.Fact Predicate.previousFact()
          This method returns the previous fact.
 Predicate.Fact Predicate.firstFact()
          This method returns the first fact and sets the cursor at the first position of this Predicate.
 Predicate.Fact Predicate.lastFact()
          This method returns the last fact and set the cursor at the last position of this Predicate.
 Predicate.Fact Predicate.Fact.getContrary()
          Gets the contrary fact.
 

Methods in DLV with parameters of type Predicate.Fact
 void Predicate.updateFact(Predicate.Fact fact)
          This method updates (replace) the fact currently pointed by the cursor if it exists, otherwise NoSuchFactException is thrown.
 void Predicate.updateFact(int i, Predicate.Fact fact)
          This method updates (replace) the i-th fact if it exists, otherwise NoSuchFactException is thrown.
 void Predicate.addFact(Predicate.Fact fact)
          This method append a new Fact to this Predicate.
 boolean Predicate.Fact.isContrary(Predicate.Fact f)
          If this fact is the contrary of f returns true, otherwise false.
